title: 黑警冇入過產房？外記Richard Scotford: 佢地講大話，有人報料

replies.msg:
IMPORTANT INFO ABOUT POLICE LYING about entering an antenatal ward.
Below is the message that was sent to me from the nurse on that ward.
——————————————

Maybe you have heard the news that a male police entered the antenatal ward in Tuen Mun Hospital to arrest a pregnant woman.
In this issue, the police was blamed for entering a female ward without reasonable explanation. Then, the police force called a press conference yesterday to deny such an accusation.
However, my wife knows the truth and the police was telling lie.
Because my wife is practising as a registered nurse and midwife at that hospital.

1. Male Police Entering Delivery Suite�
Normally, a pregnant woman is sent to the Delivery Suite first for routine gynaecological examination, and then transferred to the Antenatal Ward. As the police said at the press conference, they did not enter the Antenatal Ward. However, what they did not reveal is that they actually entered the Delivery Suite, instead of the Antenatal Ward. The pregnant woman arrested was suspected of leaking amniotic fluid, awaiting examination in the delivery Suite. She had to take off all of her clothings and put on the surgical gown. She was then sent to the Delivery Suite and laid on bed, opened the legs and let the physician collect the fluid from vagina for examination. At that moment, the male police claimed that he has to take a statement from the patient so that he entered the delivery room.
2. Ward In-Charge Infringing Patients’ Privacy�
There were one male and one female police at the site. When the police on duty claimed that they have to take a statement from the patient, the IN-CHARGE personally allowed the male police to enter the delivery room, while leaving the female police outside. And more importantly, there were other pregnant women inside the delivery room apart from the suspect.
3. Police Lied in the Press Conference�
The arrested pregnant woman was sent to hospital in the midnight. In the press conference, the police claimed that there were other male relatives in the ward, which was not the truth. The fact is that no relative is allowed to enter the ward area except during visiting hours: from 12 noon to 1pm and from 5:30pm to 8:30pm.
The police force is clearly violating the human rights and insulting the female, especially the pregnant women. This is totally unacceptable in such a civilised city.
————————————
